Subjective: Hard stools for ~3 months; difficult to pass. Bowel movements every 2-3 days. Associated abdominal cramps, pain on pressure, and bloated sensation. Appetite is chronically poor, eats very little. Chronically underweight but no recent weight loss. No blood in stool. No change in urination. Menses regular. Tried olive oil at home, which helped soften stool. Social: Sister has ulcerative colitis. Request: Wants to know if condition is serious and what can be done to soften stools.
Objective: Abdomen: Visibly swollen/bloated. Auscultation: Normal bowel sounds. Percussion: Varying tympani; dampening noted in Left Lower Quadrant. Palpation: No tenderness in upper abdomen or Right Lower Quadrant. No renal lodge/CVA tenderness. Tenderness/sensitivity noted in Left Lower Quadrant.
Assessment: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), constipation-predominant type. No alarm symptoms noted.
Plan: Take daily with plenty of water for the next 6 weeks.
Safety Netting: Return sooner if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or significant blood appears in stool.
Will discuss referral to a dietitian at the next visit for underweight status.
